title: Michael Douglas and Glenn Close reunited | Daily Mail Online
text: Buy now As they were: Michael and Glenn pictured with Anne Archer (right) back in 1987 in a promotional shot for the movie However, things take a sinister turn when Alex becomes obsessed and clinging, slitting her wrists, telling him she's pregnant and famously boiling his pet rabbit alive. The actress recently discussed the infamous scene in an Entertainment Weekly reunions special: 'The bunny was the one thing I had a question about. 'I took the script to a psychiatrist and said, 'is this behaviour possible? Could somebody do something like that?' The answer was yes. 'Then the character became very interesting to me,' she added. 'I had a huge empathy for that character by the end of the process.' Selfie time: The stars appeared to be taking snapshots of themselves as they met up again Cast snap: Michael and Catherine posed with Glenn and the Sunset Boulevard cast She said: 'I walked in and the first thing I saw was a video camera, which was terrifying, and behind the video camera in the corner was Michael Douglas, 'I just said, 'Well, just let it all go wild.' The approach paid off, as she blew away the casting executives and her co-star. Michael said: 'She came in, in character, and knocked our socks off. She kicked ass.' Glenn won an Academy Award nomination for best actress for her iconic turn, but she controversially lost out to singing star Cher for her performance in Moonstruck.
